      • avg

        public static float avg(float... ds)

      • validFloat

        public static boolean validFloat(float f)

      • limitAngle

        public static float limitAngle(float value)
        Limits a given degree to a range of 0 to 360. The given angle must be in degrees. If the angle is between 0 and 360 it will be returned. Otherwise, if its absolute value is bigger than 360, the angle will be reduced to the corresponding value between 0 and 360 according to the unit circle. If the angle is negative, its value will be changed to a corresponding positive angle according to the unit circle.
        Parameters:
        value - An angle in degrees to limit.
        Returns:
        The value of the angle after being limited.

      • limit

        public static float limit(float value,
                          float min,
                          float max)
        Makes sure that a given value is within a given limit. If the value is outside that limit, its value will be changed to meet the limit accordingly: value bigger than max : value = max value smaller than min : value = min
        Parameters:
        value - The value to limit
        min - The minimum limit
        max - The maximum limit
        Returns:
        The new value after making sure it is within the given limit.

      • pythagorasTheorem

        public static float pythagorasTheorem(float a,
                                      float b,
                                      float c)
        Gets the result of Pythagorases theorem for a given set of numbers. The Pythagorean theorem states that: In any right triangle, the area of the square whose side is the hypotenuse (the side opposite the right angle) is equal to the sum of the areas of the squares whose sides are the two legs (the two sides that meet at a right angle). This method implements it in a 3d space.
        Parameters:
        a - a
        b - a
        c - a
        Returns:
        The result for pythagorasTheorem for given values

      • pythagorasTheorem

        public static float pythagorasTheorem(float a,
                                      float b)
        Gets the result of Pythagorases theorem for a given set of numbers. The Pythagorean theorem states that: In any right triangle, the area of the square whose side is the hypotenuse (the side opposite the right angle) is equal to the sum of the areas of the squares whose sides are the two legs (the two sides that meet at a right angle).
        Parameters:
        a - a
        b - a
        Returns:
        The area of the square whose side is the hypotenuse

        Calculates the nth root of a given number.
        Parameters:
        result - The result of the base in the power of exponent.
        exponent - The root exponent
        Returns:
        The base who when multiplied exponent times returns the given result
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if result is negative
